briefdescription.para: Typedef for shared-pointer to FieldTransform object.
FieldType is a hash number of a description.

detaileddescription.para: FieldType is a hash number (see note at the end of this comment) created from a description for that FieldType. This means that it is important to maintain different descriptions of each field, as the same description leads to the same hash. It is strongly advised to use the following convention:

A description is built up from a category path. Each category starts with a capital letter and must not contain any spaces. Following the category name is a colon followed by a space and the description of the next sub-category or the actual string identifying the specific field. The same conventions as for categories are used on the string identifier.
Examples can be seen in FieldType.h

Note: A hash number is a fixed length key that uniquely indexes a variable length key. Hash numbers are mostly used to accelerate table lookup or data comparison tasks such as finding items in a database (Wikipedia). Here, each field type (variable length) is associated with a hash number of fixed length.

briefdescription.para: Function to merge three double multi-arrays of N dimension into a single Vector3d multi-array.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to merge three double multi-arrays of N dimension into a single Vector3d multi-array, where the three double multi-arrays represent the x-, y- and z-components of the Vector3ds.
xComponents
Multi-array containing the x-components of the Vector3d
yComponents
Multi-array containing the y-components of the Vector3d
zComponents
Multi-array containing the z-components of the Vector3d
Single multi-array containing Vector3ds according to double multi-arrays.

memberdef.name: readAerodynamicCoefficients

briefdescription.para: Function to read a list of aerodynamic coefficients and associated independent variables from a set of files.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to read a list of aerodynamic coefficients of NumberOfDimensions independent variables and associated independent variables from a set of files.
fileNames
Vector of size 3, containing the file names for the x-, y- and z- components of the aerodynamic coefficients. Note that the independent variables for each components must be identical.
Pair: first entry containing multi-array of aerodynamic coefficients, second containing list of independent variables at which coefficients are defined.

memberdef.type: std::pair< boost::multi_array< Eigen::Vector3d, static_cast< size_t > NumberOfDimensions) >, std::vector< std::vector< double > > >
memberdef.definition: std::pair< boost::multi_array< Eigen::Vector3d, static_cast< size_t > NumberOfDimensions ) >,std::vector< std::vector< double > > > tudat::input_output::readAerodynamicCoefficients
memberdef.name: readAerodynamicCoefficients

briefdescription.para: Function to read a list of aerodynamic coefficients and associated independent variables from a set of files.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to read a list of aerodynamic coefficients of 2 independent variables and associated independent variables from a set of files.
fileNames
Map of file names, with the key required to be 0, 1 and/or 2. These indices denote the x-, y- and z- components of the aerodynamic coefficients. All indices that are not provided in this map are assumed to have associated coefficients equal to zero for all values of the independent variables Note that the independent variables for each components must be identical.
Pair: first entry containing multi-array of aerodynamic coefficients, second containing list of independent variables at which coefficients are defined.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double floatingPointNumber, const int basePrecision=std::numeric_limits< double >::digits10, const int exponentWidth=2)
memberdef.name: printInFormattedScientificNotation

briefdescription.para: Print floating-point number in formatted scientific notation.

detaileddescription.para:
Prints floating-point number in formatted scientific notation. The user can specify the precision that the base is represented by (default=maximum precision for doubles), and the number of digits (width) in the exponent (default=2). This function can be used to ensure that the string output generated in scientific notation is the consistently the same for all platforms.
floatingPointNumber
Floating-point number to format.
basePrecision
Number of digits to represent the base of the floating-point number.
exponentWidth
Number of digits to represent the exponent of the floating-point number.
Formatted string representation of floating-point number in scientific notation.

briefdescription.para: List all files in directory.

detaileddescription.para: Lists all files in directory.

Lists all files in a given directory. There is a recursion option to allow all files in subdirectories to be listed as well.
directory
Absolute directory path.
isRecurseIntoSubdirectories
Flag to set if algorithm should recurse through subdirectories. Set to false by default.
Container of filenames in directory, stored as Boost path variables.

memberdef.argsstring: (OutputStream &stream, const ValueType &value, const int precision, const std::string &delimiter)
memberdef.name: writeValueToStream

briefdescription.para: Write a value to a stream.

detaileddescription.para:
Write a value to a stream, left-aligned at a specified precision. Value is preceded by delimiter followed by a space, and followed by an end-of-line character. Helper function for writeDataMapToTextFile().
OutputStream
Type of the stream to write to.
ValueType
Type of the value to write, should support the << operator.
stream
Stream to write to.
value
Value to write to stream.
precision
Precision to write the value with.
delimiter
Delimiter to precede the value.

memberdef.argsstring: (OutputStream &stream, const Eigen::Matrix< ScalarType, NumberOfRows, NumberOfColumns, Options, MaximumRows, MaximumCols > &value, const int precision, const std::string &delimiter, const bool endLineAfterRow=0)
memberdef.name: writeValueToStream

param.type: const Eigen::Matrix< ScalarType, NumberOfRows, NumberOfColumns, Options, MaximumRows, MaximumCols > &

briefdescription.para: Write an Eigen type to a stream.

detaileddescription.para:
Write an Eigen type to a stream, row-by-row and left-aligned at a specified precision. Each value is preceded by delimiter followed by a space, and followed by an end-of-line character. Helper function for writeDataMapToTextFile().
OutputStream
Type of the stream to write to.
ScalarType
Scalar type for Eigen::Matrix to write to stream.
NumberOfRows
Number of rows in Eigen::Matrix to write to stream.
NumberOfColumns
Number of columns in Eigen::Matrix to write to stream.
Options
options for Eigen::Matrix to write to stream.
MaxiumumRows
Maximum number of rows for Eigen::Matrix to write to stream.
MinimumRows
Minimum number of rows for Eigen::Matrix to write to stream.
stream
Stream to write to.
value
Value to write to stream.
precision
Precision to write the value with.
delimiter
Delimiter to precede the value.
endLineAfterRow
Boolean to denote whether a new line is to be started after each row of the matrix

briefdescription.para: Convert number to string with specified number of decimals.

detaileddescription.para:
Convert number to string with specified number of decimals.

Type of value to be converted.
valueToBeConverted
Number of type ValueType to be converted to string.
precision
Number specifiying number of decimals to be used during conversion.
String containing valueToBeConverted with the number of decimals specified in precision.

memberdef.argsstring: (InputIterator iteratorDataMap, InputIterator last, const std::string &outputFilename, const boost::filesystem::path &outputDirectory, const std::string &fileHeader, const int precisionOfKeyType, const int precisionOfValueType, const std::string &delimiter)
memberdef.name: writeDataMapToTextFile

briefdescription.para: Write data map to text file.

detaileddescription.para:
Writes data stored in a map to text file.
InputIterator
Iterator of pairs.
iteratorDataMap
Iterator to the first item of the sequence to write.
last
Iterator to the item past the the last item of the sequence to write.
outputFilename
Output filename.
outputDirectory
Output directory. This can be passed as a string as well. It will be created if it does not exist.
fileHeader
Text to be placed at the head of the output file. N.B: This string MUST end in a newline/return character, or the first line of data will not be printed on a new line.
precisionOfKeyType
Number of significant digits of KeyType-data to output.
precisionOfValueType
Number of significant digits of ValueType-data to output.
delimiter
Delimiter character, to delimit data entries in file.

briefdescription.para: Write data map to text file.

detaileddescription.para:
Writes data stored in a map to text file, using default KeyType-precision and ValueType-precision (digits10 from "limits" standard library), output directory (Tudat root-path), and delimiter (space). Do not use this function for Eigen types. Instead, use the function that accepts a map as input parameter below, or the function with the full argument list. Otherwise, your input will be truncated.
InputIterator
Iterator of pairs.
first
Iterator to the first item of the sequence to write.
last
Iterator to the item past the the last item of the sequence to write.
outputFilename
Output filename.

KeyType
Data type for map key.
ValueType
Data type for map value.
dataMap
Map with data.
outputFilename
Output filename.

detaileddescription.para:
Writes Eigen data stored in a map to text file, using default KeyType-precision and ValueType-precision (digits10 from "limits" standard library), output directory (Tudat root-path), and delimiter (space).
KeyType
Data type for map key.
ValueType
Data type for Eigen::Matrix, used as map value.

Map with data.
outputPath
Path of the output file.
fileHeader
Text to be placed at the head of the output file. N.B: This string MUST end in a newline/return character, or the first line of data will not be printed on a new line.

Number of significant digits of KeyType-data and ValueType-data to output.

memberdef.name: writeMatrixToFile

briefdescription.para: Write Eigen matrix to text file.

detaileddescription.para:
Write Eigen matrix to text file.
matrixToWrite
Matrix that is to be written to a file
outputFilename
Output filename.
precisionOfMatrixEntries
Number of significant digits of Matrix output
outputDirectory
Output directory. It can be passed as a string as well. The directory be created if it does not exist.
delimiter
Delimiter character, to delimit data entries in file.
header
Header to be added in the first line. Header char (e.g. %, #), if any, must be included in this string. Must end in line break to make data matrix start in the next line.

briefdescription.para: Read a map of Eigen vectors from a text file.

detaileddescription.para:
Read a textfile whith separated (space, tab, comma etc...) values. The first element of each line is a key. Successive elements in the current line are the associated values, converted to Eigen column vector.
The scalar type of EigenVectorType is used for the keys of the returned map.
relativePath
Relative path to file.
separators
Separators used, every character in the string will be used as separators. (multiple seperators possible).
skipLinesCharacter
Skip lines starting with this character.
The map with data as read from the file.

briefdescription.para: Read a map of std vector from a text file.

detaileddescription.para:
Read a textfile whith separated (space, tab, comma etc...) values. The first element of each line is a key. Successive elements in the current line are the associated values, stored as an STL vector.
relativePath
Relative path to file.
separators
Separators used, every character in the string will be used as separators. (multiple seperators possible).
skipLinesCharacter
Skip lines starting with this character.
The map with data as read from the file.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &relativePath, const std::string &separators="\t ;,", const std::string &skipLinesCharacter="%", const int numberOfHeaderLines=0)
memberdef.name: readMatrixFromFile

briefdescription.para: Read the file and return the data matrix.

detaileddescription.para:
Read a textfile whith separated (space, tab, comma etc...) numbers. The class returns these numbers as a matrixXd. The first line with numbers is used to define the number of columns.
relativePath
Relative path to file.
separators
Separators used, every character in the string will be used as separators. (multiple seperators possible).
skipLinesCharacter
Skip lines starting with this character.
numberOfHeaderLines
Number of header lines, i.e., number of lines to be skipped at the beginning of the file.
The data matrix.

independentVariableSize
Size of independent variables (must be of size 1)
coefficientsBlock
Raw number block as read from file.
Multi-array of size 1, according to input data.

memberdef.name: readCoefficientsFile

briefdescription.para: Function to read a coefficient file (data on a structured grid as a function of N independent variables)

detaileddescription.para:
Function to read a coefficient file (data on a structured grid as a function of N independent variables). This function reads the file as raw data, converting the data into a multi-array of the correct size can be done using the MultiArrayFileReader class if needed. The file format is defined in the Tudat wiki.
fileName
Name of file containing coefficients,
independentVariables
Independent variables of coefficients, as read from file (returned by reference)
coefficientBlock
Block of coefficients, as read from file (returned by reference)

briefdescription.para: Function to retrieve the number of independent variables that the coefficients in a file are given for.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to retrieve the number of independent variables that the coefficients in a file are given for.
fileName
Name of the file containing the coefficients.
Number of independent variables that the coefficients in a file are given for.

memberdef.name: readTabulatedAtmosphere

briefdescription.para: Function to read a list of atmosphere parameters and associated independent variables from a set of files.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to read a list of atmosphere parameters of 2 independent variables and associated independent variables from a set of files.
fileNames
Map of file names, with the key required to be 0, 1 and/or 2. These indices denote the x-, y- and z- components of the atmosphere parameters. All indices that are not provided in this map are assumed to have associated coefficients equal to zero for all values of the independent variables Note that the independent variables for each components must be identical.
Pair: first entry containing multi-array of atmosphere parameters, second containing list of independent variables at which coefficients are defined.
